reviewText: By far this is the best fishing simulator i have ever played, at first you have to buy your fishing rod from a merchant. Then you work your way to better, and better fishing grounds via a dungeon. to help protect you while fishing you may purchase armor from merchants (with money you get from fishing!) or use the fish you catch to put a spell on your dog/cat to turn it into a more powerful creature to protect you from those who want to steal your fish.\n\n10/10 would fish again.

reviewText:
Oh, FATE: The Traitor Soul! Fun, delightful, charming. It's a magnificent game, and there's so much to do! One of the best and most enjoyable games I've ever played. It was an instant buy when I saw it here again, even though I already have an official copy from WildTangent's own service.

The music, the graphics, the gameplay...it's all wonderful. I can't say enough about how much I love it. Plus you get to choose various races and animal companions, including a fox! They make authentic noises and the companion really adds a tremendous amount to the game. It is generally a very accessible game, not overcomplicated, but you can get into really exciting complexity with gear, magic, and the stats that suit your play preferences.

The Traitor Soul is a game I have literally played for years, and I've never grown tired of it. It's easy to pick up, play a bit, and put down...or play for hours and lose yourself in its absorbing adventures. There is literally limitless appeal and lasting gameplay value! At this price it's a steal, so please do yourself a favour and pick up FATE: The Traitor Soul today. It will be a faithful companion to you forever.

reviewText:
I never imagined I'd be posting a negative review for any of the FATE games ...

Not only was FATE a blast to play in its day.  But it should be of special interest to anybody who happens to be a fan of both Diablo II and Torchlight.  FATE is like the missing link that came between those two games.

Sadly, the only reason for my thumbs-down here is to help purchasors beware it's become impossible for most users to play any of the FATE games anymore under Windows 10.

So I'd just hold onto your wallets for now:  Don't  assume that since your other games are still running smoothly after you upgraded to Windows 10 that any of the FATE series will.  It won't!

FATE unfortunately just has critical compatibility issues now with Windows 10; can't get any further than the first menu or so for most users without a crash to desktop no matter what tips they try.

It's a shame to lose being able to play such a classic as FATE.   So I'm still hoping for a Steam/Wildtangent fix.  But until then, I'd just continue to watch this space.

reviewText: A simple game that needs (or gives) very little explanation. Think of it as Torchlight 0.5, the father of the much more well known series. It consists of a practically endless dungeon, classless freeform character building, and the ability to retire characters in order to roll their best items onto another character. The dungeons are randomly generated, as are the side quests. This means that really the only static quests you'll see are the ones to defeat so-and-so" boss on "such-and-such" floor of Dungeon #
date: as well as the unspoken ones such as returning the Heroic items back to their respective Hero Statues for a reward.\n\nIf you're looking for an in-depth story feel free to move along
recommended: but for those satisfied with some casual hack and slash
hoursPlayed: you're in the right place! Don't let my hours played fool you
voteText: I only just recently picked up the Steam version
helpfulPercent: I've sunk a decently sized portion of my life into the original with a boxed version
votesHelpful: and Traitor Soul is all that and more!\n\nOverall
votesTotal: Fate is good for a casual dungeon crawl when you aren't in the mood for something requiring more thought. It can be paused at any time
votesFunny: and you can save and exit anywhere you like to continue exactly where you left off later. There are some slight targeting issues that I've noticed
commentsCount: but nothing significantly gamebreaking.\n\nWhile I wouldn't necessarily recommend it at full price due to its age
column16:
Fate's a worthy purchase when it hits sale prices for those who want to take a quick relaxing adventure into a deep and dangerous dungeon with few demands and plenty of freedom.

Despite recent reviews
column17: the game DOES in fact work on Windows 10
column18: however it takes a little bit of effort on the owner's part. Fixing it up requires running the game once in order to initialize
column21: then following the instructions found at Wild Tangent's support site: https://support.wildtangent.com/hc/en-us/articles/205720935-FATE-on-Windows-10 with a slight correction
column22: the game's folder you're looking for is "FateTheTraitorSoulSteam".\n\nThe short form of this is to take the config.dat file found at the bottom of their support post and deposit it into the correct ProgramData folder (in the case of Steam's version of Traitor Soul
column23: C:\ProgramData\WildTangent\FateTheTraitorSoulSteam\persistent). You can then open this file in notepad (or your favorite text editor) and edit the first
column25:
and fourth lines. These are the screen resolution and fullscreen options.

What's making the game crashing is that Windows 10 doesn't like such a low resolution full screen application taking over the screen. Setting a higher resolution and/or disabling fullscreen does the trick. This fix works for ANY of the Fate games.

As well
column26: if you're into modding your game and want to add a bit more oomph (and content
column27: such as being able to fully adventure through the first Fate's Grove)
column28:
there are a couple more things you can grab.

The first: Heron's Fate Fanpatch 1.0 ( http://fatemods.shivtr.com/forum_threads/1590087 )
This adds additional content
column30: and smooths out some bugs. Be sure you pick up the FTS 1.0 file
column31: NOT the FUR 1.5 file. The latter is for Undiscovered Realms
column32:
which is unnecessary in this case (and the wrong game besides).

The second: Heron's World of Fate 2.9 ( http://fatemods.shivtr.com/forum_threads/1590084 )
This includes quite a bit of extra content as well as enabling some of the content found in an older
column33: no-longer-available compilation of the first three Fate games combined. It also reorders zones and their level ranges in order to give the game a better flow as you test your fate across the various realms.\n\nInstall them in that order
column36: and you'll be good to go!\n\nKeep in mind that there's no guarantee that you'll be able to import your character into Cursed King if you use these mods
column37: but due to the nature of the 4th Fate game that may not necessarily be a negative. Fate CK is more of a sequel than an expansion and while it gives the option to import your characters from Traitor Soul
column38: you should feel gently encouraged to start anew."

reviewText:
Been playing for 4.4 Hours at the time of this review and I just have to say that I LOVE this game. It's a lot like Diablo 2 or Dungeon Siege 2 but it's still purely brilliant!

Some of the pros (as some already mentioned) :
+You can play this game for hours as you can play up to level 2,305 if you wish. There is no limit to how powerfull you can become.
+Customize your character from a variety of races, each with it's own buffs
+Pet system.
+Fishing is amazing in this game + a great way to earn fast gold.
+Customize your charcter with TONS of skills, abilities, armor, and magic that suits your playstyle.

Some downs :
- A bit repetitive for some (not for me though, I love grinding).
- You'll have to deciede which weapon and so forth you want early on otherwise you'll end up with a useless character.
- Enhancing costs A LOT of gold.

Im going to give this game 10/10 cause it have all that I want in an RPG and Hack-n-slach/dungeon crawler title.
Just pick this one up and play for hours. See you, reality! Im going to next level of the dungeon!

//VincentMusic

reviewText:
Fate : The Traitor Soul

(Update 2014-11-12 - based only on few hours of play reaching dungeon floor 26 char level 18)

My first start was only pain because i meet mobs higher level than me, hard to kill in melee with starting gear. And got killed many times by quest monsters in team.
Today i decided to start another party, always at lower difficulty level. I started ranger & i succeded for 1st time to reach underground floor 6 without problem.


+ Musics : nice
+ Class system : 4 classes with specific starting advantages (Mage, Ranged bow, Warrior & Tech)
+ Socket & Gem system : all gear can be socketed with many gem choices
+ Free evolution level up : you are free to allocate as you want points to share in melee, magic or ranged. That mean any class can use magic (for protections, buff or summons), ranged (bow) or lot of melee weapons.
+ Pet system : 5 pets to help fighting & selling in dungeons, number of equiped items increased then previous Fate. Pet have his own xp.
+ Gambling system : when you'll become rich, gambler in city will offer you items with lot of enchantments
+ Random enchantment system : npc in cimetery will enchant randomly all your gear (basic/epic echantment, sockets add, unenchantment or negative sometimes)
+ Fame system : npc give additional quests to increase faster your fame, money, xp. You'll get faster lot of points to allocate in skills.
+ Fishing system : random loots when fishing (city/dungeons), fishes can boost pets
+ Random shrine in dungeons : enchant once, recover mana/hp, random stats bonus/malus
+ Mimic : be carefull all chests isn't lootable ^^
+ Retirement & rebirth system : once you end game, you can decide to retire. You'll char won't be able to fight but you'll be able to rebirth passing powers/item to your new char for new playthrougth.
+ Fate is THE game who inspired Torchlight serie (Thx to http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198138097297 (Drez) to report me Torchlight was clone)

- Gameplay badder than Torchlight
- Graphics badder than Torchlight
- Unbalanced difficulty : even if you start as page" you can meet early higher level team monsters to kill you before you earn money to be well equiped
- Map : city & underground only
date:
chained maps without open world
- No respec
- Solo game
- No shared stash


For those who played Torchlight first
recommended: Fate will perhaps decieve you because gameplay & graphics badder. Historical
hoursPlayed: Fate concept was created before than Torchlight. This 2nd sequel suffer with no multi options.\n\nI need more practice & investigation to recommend this game. At this time
voteText: even if game unbalanced
helpfulPercent: there is no reason to boycott Fate. Stay one best choice when discounted."

reviewText:
First off, everyone should be aware this game does NOT work on Windows 10 without some tweaking, however this is a very fun game to play. Yes, it can get repetitive, and yes there are some BS situations you can get yourself into, but becasue it lacks any real story you get a true dungeon crawler where your objective is not to save the princess or become the king, or even kill the devil. What you get is a game that is simple and uncomplicated.

Basicly you kill things. Alot of things.

I like this game becasue its simple and a nice break from bad plot writing and terrible mechanics that plague a lot of games that have come out recently, and you don't need DLC to enjoy it fully. Its just meant to be fun, and I like that.
